Exodus

2:1-1-

0 New Living

Translation

(1) During this time, a man and woman from the tribe of Levi got married. (2) The woman

became pregnant and gave birth to a son. She saw what a beautiful baby he was and kept

him hidden for three months. (3) But when she could no longer hide him, she got a little

basket made of papyrus reeds and waterproofed it with tar and pitch. She put the baby in

the

basket and laid it among the reeds along the edge of the Nile River. (4) The baby's sister

then stood at a distance, watching to see what would happen to him. (5) Soon after this, one

of Pharaoh's daughters came down to bathe in

the river, and her servant girls walked along

the riverbank. When the princess saw the little basket among the reeds, she told one of her

servant girls to get

it for her. (6) As the princess opened it,

she found the baby boy. His

helpless cries touched her heart. "He must be one of the Hebrew children," she said.

(7)Then the baby's sister approached the princess. "Should

I

go and find one of the Hebrew

women to nurse the baby for you?" she asked. (8) "Yes, do!" the princess replied. So the girl

rushed home and called the baby's mother. (9) "Take this child home and nurse him for me,"

the princess told her.

"I will pay you for your help." So the baby's mother took her baby home

and nursed him. (10) Later, when he was older, the child's mother brought him back to the

princess, who adopted him as her son. The princess named him Moses, for she said,

"I

drew him out of the water."

(Moses' father and mother named

in

I

in with them as much as

can. In this way,

I

gain their confidence and bring them to Christ.

But

obey the law of Christ. (22) When

I

am with

those who

are oppressed,

share their oppression so that

might bring them to Christ. Yes,

I

try to find

common ground with everyone so that

I

might bring them to Christ.

Holy Greetings to

the Delegates:

I

give all glory, honor and praise to God for the numerous blessings He hath bestov

upon us.

As we assemble for our 59th Annual Women's International Convention and Crusade le in

the Mile High City of Denver, Colorado, let us unite in prayer asking God to strategically

empower us with His Holy Spirit, as we "Strategize To Implement The Ministry To All

People."

Many thanks to our Chief Apostle, Presiding Bishop Charles Edward Blake for our

national theme,

"All Things, All People, All Godly Strategies." We are grateful for his

Leadership, let us be followers, united, seeking God's direction in fulfilling our assigned

tasks in ministry. Thanks to the General Board, the Board of Bishops and all of the men

of God for your support.

Beloved Women of God , let us unite in prayer, praise, worship, and fellowship, as we

strive to promote Better Homes, Better Churches, Better Communities and a Better

World. Let us continue to lift the Banner of Holiness for Hebrews 12:14 states, "follow

all men, and holiness, without which no man shall see the

Lord."

service,

Mae Rivers

EPISTLE FROM THE PRESIDING BISHOP

YOUR SERVANT IN CHRIST

All Things, All People, All Godly Strategies!

Mother Rivers, Officers of the Women's Department, and Delegates to the 2009 Women's

Convention:

To the great women of the Church of God in Christ, Inc; especially to the leader of the Women's

Department, Mother Willie Mae Rivers, the Executive Board, and the Advisory Board, grace and peace

from our Lord Jesus Christ!

During this 2009 convention of the Women's Department in Denver, Colorado, it is my signal honor to

share my respect, appreciation, and honor for the work and added value of your department to the

Kingdom of God and the success of the CHURCH OF GOD IN CHRIST, INC. in advancing an agenda of

holiness, righteousness, and abundant living through Christ! Your rich history of faithful support to

the training and development of women at every level of the Church's structure is commendable and

speaks volumes about why we continue to be strong in the matters God has placed in our hearts,

mind, and our hands.

As you gather for fellowship, prayer, worship, and teaching, please know that my intercession for you,

before our God, is that HIS will be done among the saints.

I

pray HIS choice blessings of revival,

inspiration, healing, deliverance, and a fresh anointing be an endowment from the Father of our Lord

Jesus Christ that will rest with the saints and be sustained throughout the course of this year.

As the world presents challenges, it is

the Holy Spirit's expectation that we yield to the Lord's

commission to press our way into the matters of life and insure the

Kingdom-advanc- e is secured,

impactful, and brings glory to our God and King!

Let's keep our minds and hearts stayed on the love of Christ and the communion of the Holy Ghost

who seeks to walk among us, in us, and in front of us! Let me commend to you the same words of the

Apostle Paul to the Church at Corinth: "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. My love be

with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen."

I

Cor. 16:23-2- 4

Your servant in Christ,

Bishop Charles E. Blake, Sr.

The Seventh in Succession

Presiding Bishop

THE CHURCH OF GOD IN CHRIST, INC.

May 25, 2009

Greetings:

On behalf of the State of Colorado,

I

would like to welcome you to the

59th

Women's

International ConventionCrusade.

We believe no place better lends itself to a conference than our state. Colorado's outdoors

provides a great opportunity to enjoy the scenery, while our climate is the envy of the

nation. Our Rocky Mountains provide an opportunity to hike, ski, and relax with

beautiful accommodations throughout the state. We hope your stay in Colorado is a

pleasurable experience.

I

wish you the best for a successful event. It is our hope that you can come enjoy the

beauty and friendliness of this great western state again.

Sincerely,

Bill Ritter, Jr.

Governor

December 4, 2008

On behalf of the City and County of Denver,

I

am pleased to extend a warm welcome to Mrs.

Willie Mae Rivers, National Supervisor of Women, Church Of God In Christ Worldwide, and

the many delegates and attendees of the

59th

International Women's ConventionCrusade.

As the host city of the National Democratic Convention where the Honorable Barack Obama was

nominated to become the official nominee of the Democratic Party for President of the United

States, we are especially thrilled and delighted that you have chosen Denver as your host city for

such a vital spiritual event.

It is our hope that while you are here you will have the opportunity to embrace our city. From

our colorful mountain peaks, to our mile high altitude that we love to say, "makes us a mile

closer to heaven", I truly hope you will enjoy the vitality, spirit, and varied traditions that Denver

has to offer.

It is indeed an honor to welcome you to Denver and I wish you all the best for a successful and

spiritually renewing

59Ih

International Women's Convention Crusade.

Sincerely,

John W. Hickenlooper

To Our Saintly Mother Willie Mae Rivers, International Supervisor:

It is with great honor to have this opportunity to extend greetings to

you and the great women of the Church of God in Christ as they attend the

Department's Annual International Women's Convention Crusade in the Mile

High City of Denver, Colorado.

Mother, you are to be commended for the level of excellence you

displayed in planning and conducting this convention crusade. We also

commend you for your reverence to the Lord and your unyielding

commitment to the women of God.

We pray that God's divine protection will envelope each attendee and

that each one will be divinely energized by the sweet fragrance of His grace.

May God's favor and blessings be upon you: We bless you in the name of

the

Lord.
